alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:21PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Laurel, Owsley, southeastern Estill, Jackson, central Rockcastle, western Breathitt, Lee, southwestern Wolfe and northwestern Clay Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Booth to Luner. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Beattyville, Fincastle, Booth, Vada, Whisman, Primrose, Zoe, Airedale, Zachariah and Leeco around 725 PM EDT. Williba, Canyon Falls, Tallega and Athol around 730 PM EDT. Flat, Widecreek, Fillmore and Jep Hill around 735 PM EDT. Bernstadt and Oakdale around 740 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include London, Pence, Victory, East Bernstadt, Templer, Lawson, Carmichael, War Creek, Eberle and Cruise. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle; Wolfe
